itemDescription: British sociologist, feminist, political activist and LGBTQ+ rights campaigner

wikipedia_page.main: Mary Susan McIntosh (13 March 1936 – 5 January 2013) was a British sociologist, feminist, political activist and campaigner for lesbian and gay rights in the UK.

response: * Notable members of the GLF in London: Sam Green, Angela Mason, Mary Susan McIntosh, Bob Mellors, Peter Tatchell, Alan Wakeman

The NDC was formed in July 1968, as a radical breakaway from the Third National Conference of Teaching and Research on Criminology at the University of Cambridge by seven individuals. These seven were Kit Carson, Stan Cohen, David Downes, Mary Susan McIntosh, Paul Rock, Ian Taylor and Jock Young.van Swaaningen, R. (1997) Critical Criminology: Visions from Europe, London: SAGE pg.78
*Mary Susan McIntosh, 76, British sociologist, feminist and political activist, stroke.The Independent
